channel.title: Phpmyadmin?
channel.description:
Alright, Well I have everything pretty much figured out but this, hopefully last question.
If I want multiple users to be able to create/modify/use databases how would I do that.
I used phpmyadmin but if I created a user, then the users can see and modify the other users databases...
Is there some other script I could use, or some way to modify phpmyadmin or am I setting it up wrong?

item.title: Phpmyadmin?
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

Just edited privileges of a test account from my local phpmyadmin and this is the sort of query that was run:

REVOKE ALL PRIVILEGES ON * . * FROM 'test'@'%';

REVOKE GRANT OPTION ON * . * FROM ‘test’@’%’;

GRANT SELECT ,
INSERT ,

UPDATE ,
DELETE ,
CREATE ,
DROP ,
FILE ,
INDEX ,
ALTER ,
CREATE TEMPORARY TABLES ,
CREATE VIEW ,
SHOW VIEW ,
CREATE ROUTINE,
ALTER ROUTINE,
EXECUTE ON * . * TO ‘test’@’%’ WITH MAX_QUERIES_PER_HOUR 0 MAX_CONNECTIONS_PER_HOUR 0 MAX_UPDATES_PER_HOUR 0 MAX_USER_CONNECTIONS 0 ;

Read full topic

item.title: Phpmyadmin?
item.dc:creator: @Starting_up Starting up ...
item.description:
@Starting_up wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:5, topic:300660”][quote author=eczema3 link=topic=396921.msg2947920#msg2947920 date=1252314043]
IIRC, theres a PERMISSIONS command, or maybe it was PRIVILEGES, that sets what commands users can run on which tables/databases
[/quote]

Exactly. Only allow them to work on ones that they own.[/quote]I never found no such thing.

Read full topic

item.title: Phpmyadmin?

IIRC, theres a PERMISSIONS command, or maybe it was PRIVILEGES, that sets what commands users can run on which tables/databases
